title: New: Dead Ceremony – Trophy
content:
With methods of recording music becoming ever easier and cheaper, we’re witnessing the rise of the individual, leading to, what I believe, an increased personalisation of music.

The ideas are no longer dispersed and then accumulated via four or five people, instead every little detail is up to the discretion of the sole songwriter. With the likes of Youth Lagoon and Washed Out carving out names for themselves, (albeit expanding to larger numbers on the live circuit), it’s an immensely exciting and unrestrained time to be a musician. Christopher Stewart exploits this to its core, under his moniker Dead Ceremony. New track Trophy is an expertly constructed lament; weepingly honest and blossoming into a force of fantastical beauty. (Thanks to In Love Not Limbo for the tip.)
